title: Week 1
content:
In the first week of my sophomore year, I felt a bit nervous😓. After class, I passed by Fishs Eddy, a really interesting home goods store. Ever since I was little, I've always loved these kind of delicate and cute tableware. I also passed by a second-hand tableware store where a pink teapot was displayed on the sidewalk. 🫖 It was incredibly cute.

At home, I felt a bit bored and started playing cards with my boyfriend. We used a deck of Crayon Shin-chan themed playing cards that we bought during our summer trip to Jeju Island. The designs on the cards are just too creative and cute. 🃏

title: Week 2
content:
Birthday Week 🎂!! I celebrated my birthday in 11 Tiger. This is a Thai-Japanese fusion restaurant. I chose to try their Omakase, and it was really delicious.😋

I chose Lithography as an elective course. At first, I was a bit confused, but after the teacher printed the first image using the machine, I felt I really made the right choice with this class.🥳

At weekend, I had a brunch with my boyfriend in La Mercerie. The restaurant is so beautiful, filled with flowers 💐and plants, and the food is great too. I will definitely come back!

title: Week 3
content:
Found a new game: Shawarma Legend🎮. This is a cooking game that really tests your speed, and it's easy to lose track of time while playing. I often end up playing it all afternoon.

With the rapid cooling in New York, it suddenly felt like autumn🍂. I decided to buy a pair of boots, so I went shopping on Fifth Avenue and bought a pair of Chanel boots. In the evening, I went to Balthazar for dinner, where the duck confit is exceptionally delicious.😋

title: Week 4
content:
After class on Monday, my classmate and I went to Bangkok Super Club which is really hard to book. That day was their one-year anniversary celebration, featuring a preset menu that was so delicious. I think New York's Thai food really never disappoints.

That day was also a significant one, as it was the Mid-Autumn Festival. After dinner, as we stepped outside, the sky had darkened, and the moon was full and bright. 🎑 In China, the Mid-Autumn Festival is a day for family reunions, with the full moon symbolizing the coming together of loved ones. I bought some moon cakes.🥮 But I missed my family a lot.

title: Week 5
content:
Homework is overwhelming! 🤯

A high school friend from Boston is coming to visit New York, so I bought lots of drinks to fill the fridge🥤—showing Chinese hospitality!

OOTD check.😎

This week’s Object as history went to the Met for field trip. We basically visit the Africa area.

title: Week 6
content:
My gaming computer finally arrived🤩! I really love playing games, especially management games.

I recently discovered a new game in the Kairosoft series called "Doraemon's Dorayaki Shop Story," and it's really fun. The game features a mosaic art style, and both the characters and food designs are very authentic to the original series./p>

At weekend, I went to Brooklyn and I found a ramen restaurant. It was really delicious.

title: Week 7
content:
My first lithograph is finally done. I quite like it; although there were some hiccups along the way, seeing the final result was very satisfying. 😄

A month ago, I booked Bangkok Super Club for 4 p.m. today, so after class, my boyfriend and I headed there. On the way, we encountered a little kitten. So cuteeee~🥺

title: Week 8
content:
This week was so interesting.

On my way to school, passing through Union Square, I noticed the Halloween atmosphere was really intense. The little pumpkins were just too cute. 🎃

I cooked a bowl of noodles using my newly bought Tsukemono Fatty🐷 noodle bowl. I really can't resist these cute dishes.

Guess who I went to see in concert: Billie Eilish! ！She has been my idol since elementary school, starting from her song "Six Feet Under." I've witnessed her transformation from a music-loving little girl into a Grammy-winning music superstar. Now, experiencing her concert in person, I was moved to tears, feeling incredibly emotional about the whole journey.

This week also marked a significant day, October 18th, the second anniversary🩷 with my boyfriend. I chose the Golden Salon at the Baccarat Hotel mainly for its atmosphere, though the food was just average. They even served a small cake at the end, which was a sweet touch to our celebration.

title: Week 9
content: The busy midterm period has finally ended, and nothing particularly interesting has happened in the past few weeks. After Halloween, the street decorations shifted to a Christmas atmosphere🎄, and the Christmas market at Union Square has started. At the market, I tried Wheel Cheese Pasta and hot cocoa☕️; chocolate 🍫really feels perfect for winter. I also saw someone carrying two cats, and they were just so adorable.

title: Week 10
content:
I missed Chinese hot pot so much. I went to Flushing for hot pot.🍲 This hot pot restaurant is really delicious. Although some dishes are not authentic, it is very comforting and satisfying to eat such Chinese cuisine in a foreign land.

Almost final week, To complete my final assignment for 'Objects as History', I visited the Whitney Museum. There, I immediately fell in love with a collage at an exhibition called 'Edges of Ailey'.
